reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: (continued of the project description above)In addition we are exploring the possibility of Finnish school system sharing expertise in Nepal. Finnish school system are recognised to be the best be it in curriculum or wide co-curricular activities. Some Nep alese states are exploring options of bringing in parts of curriculum teaching methodology in model schools and we can explore setting up a pilot programme with one state government in Nepal. This is a mid-long term project so we would have to explore furt her to articulate the revenue plans for this on. This could align with and support the Finnish government's support to Nepal's education system and improvement in quality education. In HealthTech: a 2016 report by the Finnish Health Technology Association revealed that health technology exports have grown by 6.6% compared to the previous year. In order for GOInternational Finland to co-create networking between Nordics and Nepal?s Healthtech we are constantly following the best startups and trying to connec t with the most promising ones. Together with SLUSH Nordic Investment Day Upgraded Life Festival Artic15 The Bridge Digital Health Days Nordic Life Science Days are events that are rendering this field quite dynamic with new health hubs and accelerators gr owing in Finland Sweden Norway and Denmark.In Smart Cities: Nepal is one of the top ten fastest urbanising countries in the world and will remain its rank for the period of 2014-2050 with a projected annual urbanisation rate of 1.9 percent. The opportuniti es are well-seen for ones that are ready for long term commitments and wish to optimise. However the challenge for Finnish companies especially the medium-sized companies is the way to enter the market. Some of the key solutions we should target among othe rs:- Smart mobility/Smart transportation- Traffic management- Infrastructure/IoT of things- Waste management ? Turning it into an opportunity.
